metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0133 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in in Permission prompts in Google Chrome onAndroid prior to 109.0.5414.74 allowed a remote attacker to bypass mainorigin permission delegation via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium securityseverity: Medium)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-browser-l10n - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-chromedriver - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14').
